block.p: One of Britain's largest utilities, Scottish Power, is in the final stages of negotiations to sell the Australian electricity distributor Powercor Australia to the Hong Kong billionaire Li Ka-shing for $690 million in cash and $640 million in assumed debt, an executive close to the discussions said. Powercor, which sells electricity to more than 575,000 customers, will add to Mr. Li's growing expansion in Australia, where he owns power cable and gas pipeline assets. Scottish Power acquired Powercor last year when it bought PacifiCorp, a United States utility, for $10.8 billion.
